task.title: Starting the car
task.shortdesc: The ignition switch lets you engage the engine as a precursor to starting the car. When the ignition is 'on' you can run the radio and heater. Turn the ignition to 'start' when you want to start the engine.

taskbody.context: The ignition switch is located in the centre of the control panel and is operated by a key. The switch has two position: 'on' and 'start'.

step.cmd: Insert the key into the ignition switch.
Turn the key clockwise to the 'on' position.
step.stepresult: The ignition warning light displays. Never leave the ignition switch in the 'on' position when the engine is not running because this will draw power from the battery.

step.note: Ensure the gear lever is in the neutral position.
step.cmd: Turn the key clockwise to the 'start' position.
Press the starter switch quickly and firmly.
step.stepresult: The engine starts. Don't continue to hold the starter switch down if the engine fails to start because this draws a heavy current and may completely discharge the battery.
